revised_title: Late-Weichselian Vegetation and Flora in South Eastern Britain
tldr: The author studied organic deposits at Colney Heath, Herts, to understand the late-Weichselian conditions in south-eastern Britain. They found a diverse range of plant life, including arctic birch, dwarf willows, and various dry-land plants. The plant evidence, along with animal remains, suggests that the late-Weichselian vegetation was without woodland, and the region experienced temporary and local changes in climate during the later part of the last glaciation.
